intro: Anagallis monelli var. leptensis, commonly known as the slender pinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to magenta flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in racemes. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
